meanings.definition: Unauthorized recordings or copies of a live performance or studio recording.
meanings.sent1: I bought some bootlegs of the concert from a guy on the street.
meanings.sent2: The police raided the store selling bootlegs of popular movies.
meanings.sent3: My friend thought he was being sneaky by making bootlegs of his favorite band's music.
meanings.sent4: The bootlegs of the comedian's stand-up show were spreading like wildfire online.
meanings.sent5: Bootlegs of the new album were everywhere, but I wanted to support the artist by buying the original.

meanings.definition: To engage in the illegal sale or distribution of goods.
meanings.sent1: He was caught bootlegging DVDs in the back alley.
meanings.sent2: Bootlegging designer handbags is a serious crime.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it would be funny to bootleg candy from the school store.
meanings.sent4: She was known in the neighborhood for bootlegging alcohol during prohibition.
meanings.sent5: The company lost a lot of money due to employees bootlegging company products.

meanings.definition: A type of footwear that covers the foot and ankle.
meanings.sent1: I need to buy new bootlegs for the winter.
meanings.sent2: Her favorite pair of bootlegs were worn out from all the hiking.
meanings.sent3: The fashion show featured models strutting in colorful bootlegs.
meanings.sent4: He couldn't decide between the black or brown bootlegs at the store.
meanings.sent5: The store had a sale on bootlegs, so I bought a pair in every color.
